results.title: Carol Higgins Clark, Mystery Writer, Is Dead at 66
results.abstract: She had a modest career as an actress but was best known for following in the footsteps of her mother, the best-selling author Mary Higgins Clark.

media.caption: The mystery writer Carol Higgins Clark in her Manhattan apartment in 2004. She wrote more than a dozen novels and also collaborated with her mother, Mary Higgins Clark.

results.title: Pixar’s ‘Elemental’ Falls Flat, Adding to Worries About the Brand
results.abstract: The original animated film took in $29.5 million at the box office, by far the worst opening in Pixar’s three-decade history. “The Flash,” from Warner Bros., also struggled.

media.caption: A scene from “Elemental,” a Pixar original. “If you don’t swing for original stories you can’t make new franchises, and we swung really hard,” one Disney executive said.

results.title: 23 Shot, 1 Fatally, at a Juneteenth Celebration in Illinois

results.abstract: In Los Angeles, the wealthy will pay a fortune to protect their private lives from prying eyes. At least leafy green walls are good for the environment.

results.title: Black Bear Kills Arizona Man in ‘Highly Uncommon’ Attack
results.abstract: A 66-year-old man was having a morning coffee when a male black bear dragged him down an embankment. A neighbor shot and killed the animal, officials said.

media.caption: A 66-year-old man was fatally attacked on Friday by a male black bear near Prescott, Ariz., the authorities said.
